channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed

item.description: The company plans to buy ZT Systems and bolster its ability to provide AI infrastructure.

item.title: To fix Starbucks, incoming CEO Brian Niccol will have to tackle its mobile app problem
item.description: When Brian Niccol steps in as CEO of Starbucks, he'll be tasked with fixing the chain's operational issues.

item.title: European markets higher after winning week; defense stocks fall
item.description: European stocks extended positive momentum at the start of the new trading week, after global markets rallied last week.

item.title: How to position yourself to benefit from the Fed's first rate cut in years, according to financial experts
item.description: Many types of consumer loans and savings products will be impacted once the Fed starts lowering interest rates. Here's how to position yourself to benefit.

item.title: Russia struggles to respond to Ukraine's incursion as advancing forces destroy key bridges and war potential
item.description: Ukrainian forces say they've blown up a second strategically-significant bridge in Russia's Kursk region, as Kyiv continues its incursion.

item.title: Wall Street is six times the value of Main Street, says Bank of America
item.description: By one measure, Wall Street is six times larger than the economy it ostensibly represents.

item.title: Here's why Walgreens and CVS retail pharmacies are struggling ‚Äî and what they're doing to fix it
item.description: Drugstores remain an important fixture of the U.S. health-care system that tens of millions of Americans rely on, but they may need to reinvent themselves.

item.title: Goldman Sachs cuts odds of U.S. recession to 20% after retail and jobs data
item.description: "Continued expansion would make the US look more similar to other G10 economies, where the Sahm rule has held less than 70% of the time," economists said.

item.title: Harris campaign launches $370 million fall ad push in key battlegrounds
